instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar not working
threads.message:
Hi guys,

Im working on a MBpro 16" that had a little water damage around L5199 the rest of the board is clean.
L5199 was replaced but still the touch bar is not working (also tried a new one), i have BKL in the keyboard, and:

<SIGNAL>SPI_DFR_MISO_R</SIGNAL> 0.078 V
<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_INT_L</SIGNAL> 0.080 V
<SIGNAL>DFR_LID_OPEN_L</SIGNAL> 0 V
<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0.124 V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2RSW_DFR</SIGNAL> 1.804 V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S_DFR_FILT</SIGNAL> 5.130 V

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3HSW_DFR</SIGNAL> 3.3 V

there is no touch bar options button in "sys pref"/"keyboard"

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Touch bar not working
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>DFR_TOUCH_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0.124 V"
This should be high (1.8V aprox).

Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>SPI_DFR</SIGNAL> lines.

threads.message: Liquid affected something more I suppose, possibly <CHIP>U3900</CHIP>.
